project_name: One Bank One Offer Portal (OBOP) MVP1
project_description: OBOP is an initiative by HDFC Bank to unify and centralize the offer recommendation experience across all its digital assets. By leveraging a single set of APIs and a centralized intelligence engine, OBOP aims to provide a consistent, personalized, and seamless offer experience to customers, regardless of the touchpoint they use (e.g., Payzapp, Smartbuy, Netbanking, Mobile App).
objectives: Provide a single source of truth for customer offers across all digital assets.
Unify the customer experience and ensure offer consistency across all touchpoints.
Enable real-time and batch-based offer recommendations using centralized intelligence.
Facilitate seamless SSO and cross-portal navigation for customers.
scope: In Scope (MVP1):
Integration of Smartbuy, Alliance, and Consumer Durable Loans offers.
Hashed mobile number-based customer identification.
Monthly CIU file with top 40 recommendations per customer.
Rule-engine based offer selection and real-time personalization.
Choice API integration with Smartbuy portal.
Offer Management Platform (OMP) with maker-checker flows.
Support for zip codes on store locations.
Onboarding of offers using OMP template.
Card type-based offer filtering and prioritization.
Batch file generation for non-Smartbuy assets (monthly/daily delta dumps).
SSO integration between HDFC assets and Smartbuy.
Out of Scope (MVP1):
Banking product/portfolio offers (e.g., personal loan, home loan).
Integration with third-party tools/software.
Easy EMI and other calculators.
Offer value derivation, voice/advanced search.
Real-time personalization on non-Smartbuy assets.
Interaction/performance tracking on non-Smartbuy assets.
Location-based offers for non-Smartbuy assets.
Front-end rendering on non-Smartbuy assets.
stakeholders: Offer onboarding teams (Smartbuy, Alliance, Payzapp, CDL)
CIU team (customer intelligence, recommendations, hashed IDs)
Asset owning teams (Netbanking, HDFC website, etc.)
Crayon Data (choice API, backend intelligence, OMP)
key_features: Monthly and daily batch file generation for NBOs.
Offer Management Platform with approval/rejection flows.
Personalized and generic offer lists (Curated offers, Top Trending, Top offers in city, Easy EMI/CDL).
Card type-based offer filtering and prioritization.
SSO integration for seamless cross-portal navigation.
Merchant and offer curation logic (repeat capping, fatigue factor, marketer’s veto).
technical_requirements: Choice API to be integrated with Smartbuy and other digital assets.
Monthly CIU file ingestion (parquet format, SFTP transfer, up to 50GB).
Hashed mobile number as unique customer identifier.
Batch file generation (monthly full dump, daily delta dump) for non-Smartbuy assets.
Encrypted SFTP transfer with checksum validation.
Offer Management Platform (OMP) for centralized offer repository.
Single tenant architecture for HDFC data.
API/network whitelisting between Crayon Data and R360.
Stage and Production environments for integration and performance testing.
Support for 10 million API calls/month (MVP1), scalable to 40 million/month.
Standardized data formats for offer and customer files.
Integration with SSO for cross-portal authentication.
timeline_estimate: Each sprint delivers ~2 features/improvements every 2 weeks; 5 working days for pipeline data publishing post CIU file validation; additional 5 days for major rule/structure changes. Full MVP1 timeline not explicitly stated.
risks: Potential for inconsistent customer identifiers if CIU file is not maintained properly.
System stability concerns on HDFC assets due to API integrations (hence batch approach for some assets).
Dependency on timely and accurate data from CIU and offer onboarding teams.
Inability to track user interactions or performance on non-Smartbuy assets.
Delayed integration/testing due to network whitelisting or compliance sign-offs.
SFTP size and access management rests with HDFC Bank.
assumptions: HDFC Bank will create and maintain a unified hashed mobile number for each customer.
Same rule engine will apply across all use cases.
Expected API traffic is 10 million/month for MVP1, scaling to 40 million/month.
For MVP1, HDFC Bank will share Alliance and Smartbuy offers in OMP template; from MVP2, all offers will be onboarded via OMP.
All ETB customers have debit cards; credit card possession depends on CIU file.
CIU will ensure consistent and complete customer data in each monthly file.
No real-time personalization or interaction tracking on non-Smartbuy assets.
No location-based offers for non-Smartbuy assets.
Front-end rendering on non-Smartbuy assets is HDFC Bank’s responsibility.
